name: Himalayan Breeze Jacket (Managed)
description:
The Himalayan Breeze Jacket is a testament to Peak Pulse's commitment to blending traditional craftsmanship with modern performance. Sourced and updated via the new admin CMS. Constructed from a unique, breathable fabric woven in the Kathmandu valley, this jacket offers exceptional comfort and protection against the elements.

Its minimalist design is accented with subtle traditional motifs, making it a versatile piece for any wardrobe. Features include secure zip pockets, an adjustable hood, and ethically sourced trims.
fabricDetails: Outer Shell: 70% Recycled Polyester, 30% Himalayan Nettle (Allo) fiber. Lining: 100% Organic Cotton.
careInstructions: Machine wash cold on gentle cycle. Hang dry. Do not bleach. Iron on low heat if necessary.
sustainabilityMetrics: Made with 70% recycled materials. Ethically produced by Fair Trade certified artisans in Nepal.
fitGuide: Standard fit. Model is 6'0" (183cm) and wears size Medium.

name: Kathmandu Comfort Tee (Managed)
shortDescription: Premium cotton for everyday luxury, managed via admin.
description: Experience unmatched comfort with our Kathmandu Comfort Tee. Made from the finest locally sourced organic cotton, this t-shirt is designed for a soft feel and a perfect fit. Ideal for daily wear, it features a subtle Peak Pulse logo embroidery.

name: Urban Nomad Pants (Managed)
shortDescription: Street-ready style with traditional touches, managed via admin.
description: The Urban Nomad Pants offer a unique blend of contemporary streetwear design and traditional Nepali textile patterns. Durable, comfortable, and stylish, these pants are perfect for the modern explorer. Features multiple pockets and an adjustable waistband for a custom fit.

name: sagar
shortDescription: Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s,
description:
Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old. Richard McClintock, a Latin professor at Hampden-Sydney College in Virginia, looked up one of the more obscure Latin words, consectetur, from a Lorem Ipsum passage, and going through the cites of the word in classical literature, discovered the undoubtable source. Lorem Ipsum comes from sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 of "de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum" (The Extremes of Good and Evil) by Cicero, written in 45 BC. This book is a treatise on the theory of ethics, very popular during the Renaissance. The first line of Lorem Ipsum, "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet..", comes from a line in section 1.10.32.

The standard chunk of Lorem Ipsum used since the 1500s is reproduced below for those interested. Sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 from "de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum" by Cicero are also reproduced in their exact original form, accompanied by English versions from the 1914 translation by H. Rackham.
